snippet: The good news for Israel remains tempered by the uncertainty and instability next door, but some in the country were celebrating the fall of the Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt.
abstract: Israelis see a chance for more reliable ties with Egypt and a weakening of Hamas after Mohamed Morsi's ouster and the crackdown against Muslim Brotherhood.

byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: The good news for Israel remains tempered by the uncertainty and instability next door, but some in the country were celebrating the fall of the Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt.

headline.main: Israel Sees a Chance for More Reliable Ties With Egypt and a Weakening of Hamas
headline.print_headline: Israel Sees a Chance for More Reliable Ties With Egypt and a Weakening of Hamas

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
